task.summary: Default task
Created user model -> Created registration logic to users.js -> Created login logic through username & password -> Created JSON web token -> Added JWT strategy
Formatted some lines in users.js

Added validation to login & register routes
Library used: Validator
Tested & benchmarked with Postman
Crated the Profile MongoDB schema
fixed some typo's in the mongoDB Profile schema
fixed some typo's in the mongoDB Profile schema
Added get profile route Added a route to create and update a profile Added validation to the route to create and update Tested with postman
Added routes for -> Get profile by handle -> Get profile by user_id -> GEt all profiles tested with postman

Added routes to create an experience and education to add to the profile -> Post new experience on /api/profile/experience -> Post new education on /api/profile/education -> Added validation to both new endpoints tested with postman
Added routes to delete an experience from the profile -> Delete experience on /api/profile/experience/:exp_id tested with postman
Added routes to delete an experience and education from the profile -> Delete experience on /api/profile/experience/:exp_id -> Delete education on /api/profile/education/:exp_id
Added routes to delete a profile and user -> Delete profile & user on /api/profile Tested on Postman
Added the Schema for the forum Posts
Added a route to create a post -> POST post at /api/posts/ tested with postman
Added a route to delete a post -> DELETE post at /api/posts/:id tested with postman
Added a route to like and unlike a post -> POST like at /api/posts/like -> DELETE like at /api/posts/unlike/:id (where id is the post-id) tested with postman

Added React dependencies through create-react-app. Edited package.json of the server to have new scripts --> concurrently running the server & client devs through npm run dev --> run the client --> run npm install for both client and server
Edited package.json of the client --> proxy = http://localhost:5000

Cleaned up some of the bloatfiles of create-react-app Already set up the project to use Bootstrap and React. Added all the dependencies in the index.html file Cleaned the boilerplate of the index.html file and some mor formatting
Created the landing page --> Created and added the Navbar component --> Created and added the Landing component --> Created and added the Footer component

Created Register & Login forms in the Register & Login component Added axios as the library to add functionality to the REST api Added npm package classnames and error messages for invalid inputfields
Register & Login works -> Submitting validated registration input creates a new user in the db -> Submitting validated login input returns a JWT token (bearer)

Installed and added Redux -> Created a store for Redux -> .. Initial state -> .. Middleware -> .. Functionality to work with Redux devtools chrome extension -> Added reducer for the authentication -> .. Basic template showing the initial state. -> .... No functionality as of yet
Tested with Redux devtools chrome extension

Added the root reducer that combines all the redux reducers Created an action for authorization which dispatches to the authReducer called registerUserAction Imported PropTypes and added proptypes to the Register component Created a function mapStateToProps to have the state available as prop Connected the props to the registerUserAction and the Register component

Finished the authReducer which now has a filled state when errors. Added the axios request to /api/users/register. -> When successful the user gets redirected to the login component -> When errors, GET_ERRORS action is called through errorsReducer.js -> .. The error messages come from the Validation in the Express Backend combined the authReducer and errorsReducer in the rootReducer Added errors to the state in the Register component

Added login functionality of redux to the login component -> added mapStateToProps function -> added propTypes -> connected redux to component using mapStateToProps and propTypes -> added a redirect when user successfully logs in to /dashboard -> filled the state if errors occured -> added functionality to keep the token if case of page refresh

Navbar links & functionality now changes when loggin in. -> Added variables for guests and logged in users with navbar items -> .. Navbar has a check for logged in users -> .. Navbar changes accordingly -> When logging in the gravatar shows -> Once logged in, going to the landing, login or registration pages the user gets automatically redirected to the dashboard

Created a component holding only 1 single TextField with props -> Every textfield of Login.js is replaced by that component with props -> The prop make up name, value, label, placeholder... Fixed a bug of the LoginUserAction not having a .catch in authActions.

The textfields in Register.js now also make use of the single TextFieldGroup component -> A new optional property registerEmail of the TextFieldGroup component serves as a flag for the gravatar email information text below the email field

Created the dashboard component which holds the user's profile -> Created a route for the dashboard component -> Created the profile action types in ./src/redux/actions/types.js -> Created profileActions which uses the new action types -> Created a reducer for the profiles -> Connected the dashboard component with redux and the profileActions Clicking the logout button in the navbar now clears the profile

Created a spinner component Started on the dashboard component -> Added a check if the profile is null or loading -> .. If loading the spinner now shows -> If the profile is not empty a header shows with profile username -> If the profile is empty a welcome message appears prompting the user to create a profile

Added a private route component which receives minimum 2 props -> the component to go to -> authentication info -> .. If authenticated then the component as a prop gets rendered -> .. If not authenticated the private route component redirects to /login
Imported and used Switch in App.js and enclosed the PrivateRoute- component to the dashboard inside <Switch></Switch> tags to ensure the redirection works on this private route
Check https://tylermcginnis.com/react-router-protected-routes-authentication/ for more information

Created the CreateProfile component and added it to App.js as private route -> Created the proptypes for this component -> Created the function mapStateToProps -> Connected CreateProfile to redux store with mapStateToProps

Created 3 components which will be reused throughout the project -> TextAreaFieldGroup -> SelectListGroup -> InputGroup
Added them as imports in CreateProfile.js where they will be used extensively
Added some comments explaining the actions taken -> InputGroup.js -> SelectGroup.js -> CreateProfile.js

Finished CreateProfile component -> Added functionality & axios request -> .. Profile is now added
Started on the dashboard component -> Added buttons to the dashboard component -> .. Edit profile, Link to /edit-profile -> .. Add experience, Link to /add-experience -> .. Add education, Link to /add-education -> .. Delete account -> ..... Deletes account
Added to the Redux profileActions.js to contain the actions doing the axios requests
Created the Edit profile component -> Added under /src/components/edit-profile/Edit-Profile.js -> Added functionality to edit a profile -> .. Profile now edited and saved
Created the AddExperience component -> Added all the fields -> Set the state -> Connected the state through Redux -> .. NO actions as of yet -> .. NO reducer as of yet

Added functionality to the Add-Experience component -> Axios request now gets done Added addExperienceAction to profileActions.js to handle the axios request -> Updated the addExperience component -> When submit-errors occur componentWillReceiveProps re renders w/ errors
Created the Add-Education component and added functionality -> Connected through redux -> Axios request gets done -> Updated the addExperience component -> Errors show -> education gets added into DB

Added an experience and education component to add to the dashboard component -> Experience component now shows all the experiences with deletion per experience -> Education component now shows all the educations with deletion per education -> All Redux actions were added to the profileActions.js
Added a back-button on the edit profile component

Added Profiles.js to visualize the profiles as a public route -> Connected with Redux along with its state Created the getProfiles action in profileActions Created the case for the profileReducer Added the route to App.js as a public route
Added ProfileItem.js to be displayed in the public component Profiles.js Profiles.js now displays all the profiles available in the database

Added Profile, ProfileHeader, ProfileAbout, ProfileCreds and ProfileGithub (.js) -> Profile connected to state through redux -> Added getProfileByHandle action in profileActions.js -> Added public route for Profile in App.js -> Added ProfileHeader, ProfileAbout, ProfileCreds and ProfileGithub as placeholders
Added a comment in Profile.js to illustrate the props.match.params in the componentDidMount lifecycle method
Made mockup of Profile.js to start showing the full detailed profile -> ProfileHeader added to Profile.js holding -> .. Avatar -> .. Name -> .. Title -> .. Website and social links
Profile "About" section created and added to Profile.js
Profile credentials like education and experience now added to profile.js -> Showing and available in output.
Added Github repositories to the detailed profile -> Latest 5 repo's now showing
